N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5902.4 - Applications

State Regulations
(a) Any application
for financial assistance shall be filed with the CID program manager of the
foundation, on forms supplied by the foundation, and shall contain such
information and data, in addition to that supplied in the preliminary
application or current business plan, as may be requested by the CID program
manager. (b) The applications shall
conform to applicable rules and regulations of the Economic Development

Administration of the U.S. Department of Commerce, a copy of which shall be
supplied to applicants by the foundation. (c) The application shall contain a full
disclosure of information regarding the principals of the applicant's business, including relationships with foundation officers and employees, if
any. (d) The application shall
contain a full disclosure of all owners, officers, directors, partners or
parties in interest of the business venture of the applicant, together with the
total annual compensation of each, the percentage of ownership of each and the
personal guarantee or insurance maintained by each for the benefit of the
applicant, if any. (e) The
application shall contain a statement by the applicant of every payment made, or agreed to be made, by the applicant to any person or entity in connection
with the preparation, filing or furtherance of the application. An applicant
shall be required to submit proof of all facts relating to any such payment or
agreement, at or prior to the closing of any agreement for financial assistance
with the foundation and an application shall contain a statement that the
applicant has read, understands and agrees to the provisions of this
subdivision. (f) The application
must be complete, in proper form and verified by the
applicant. Notes
